revised_title: Anatomical Study of Cranial Nerves in Elasmobranch Fishes
tldr: The author examines the cranial nerves of the Elasmobranch fish, Lcemargus, and compares them to other Elasmobranch species. They describe the structure and function of the ophthalmicus profundus, oculo-motor, and trigeminal nerves, providing a detailed analysis of their origins, branches, and roles in the nervous system of these fish. This study sheds light on the differences and similarities between the cranial nerves of various Elasmobranch species and contributes to the understanding of vertebrate neuroanatomy.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate anatomy
